solution_line_template: Benjamin walks {work_distance} miles to work and {work_distance} miles home, so he walks {work_distance} * {round_trip_multiplier} = <<{work_distance}*{round_trip_multiplier}={work_home_per_day}>>{work_home_per_day} miles to work and home.

He walks to work {work_days_per_week} days a week, so he walks {work_home_per_day} * {work_days_per_week} = <<{work_home_per_day}*{work_days_per_week}={work_home_per_week}>>{work_home_per_week} miles to work and home a week.

He walks his dog {dog_walk_times_per_day} times a day for {dog_walk_distance} miles, so he walks {dog_walk_times_per_day} * {dog_walk_distance} = <<{dog_walk_times_per_day}*{dog_walk_distance}={dog_walk_per_day}>>{dog_walk_per_day} miles a day for his dog.
He walks his dog {days_in_week} days a week, so he walks {dog_walk_per_day} * {days_in_week} = <<{dog_walk_per_day}*{days_in_week}={dog_walk_per_week}>>{dog_walk_per_week} miles for his dog.

He walks {store_distance} miles to the store {store_times_per_week} times a week, so he walks {store_times_per_week} * {store_distance} = <<{store_times_per_week}*{store_distance}={store_per_week}>>{store_per_week} miles to the store each week.

Adding his weekly {friend_distance_per_week} mile to his friend's house, Benjamin walks {work_home_per_week} + {dog_walk_per_week} + {store_per_week} + {friend_distance_per_week} = <<{work_home_per_week}+{dog_walk_per_week}+{store_per_week}+{friend_distance_per_week}={total_miles_per_week}>>{total_miles_per_week} miles in a week.
